Name: Gold Goblet of King Psusennes the First
Description: This goblet is thought to form a pair with the gold flask discovered next to it. It probably served to collect water poured over the hands of the king. The handle of the goblet is composed of a stem of three wires. At the base, the wires end in a small palm tree and at the spout of the vessel they form an elegant openwork lotus flower. Two cartouches of King Psusennes the First are inscribed on the body of the goblet.
